StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SetUserStatus_Step_1]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
AS
/*
EMAIL STATUS 0 Ac.vity present in the past 23 days 1 No ac.vity for 23 days / email warning about DEACTIVATION in 7 days 2 No ac.vity for 30 days / user account deac.vated / record isAc.ve set to 0 3 No ac.vity for 90 days / .rst email warning about DELETION in 90 days 4 No ac.vity for 173 days / second email warning about DELETION in 7 days 5 No ac.vity for 180 days / user record deleted
JOB STEP 1: Make sure ac.ve users have email status of 0
BASIC LOGIC Get all users from the UserStatus view that have been ac.ve in that past 23 days. If the user's current email status is 0, then do nothing. If the user's current email status is NULL or NOT 0, then insert a new status record with email status of 0.
SQL LOGIC Temp table of users from the UserStatus view where DATEDIFF(day,LastAc.vityDate,GETDATE()) <= 23 and (UDD_EmailStatus is NULL or UDD_EmailStatus <> 0)
For those users insert a new status record with email status of 0.
*/
SELECT * INTO #temp_UserStatus FROM [UserMgmt].[dbo].[vwUserStatus] WHERE DATEDIFF(day,LastAc.vityDate,GETDATE()) <= 23 AND (UDD_EmailStatus IS NULL OR UDD_EmailStatus <> 0)
Insert Into Usermgmt.dbo.UserDeac.va.on_Dele.on ( UserID, Username , [Last_Log_On_Date ([LastAc.vityDate]])], Title , FirstName , LastName , MiddleName , Email , Phone, UserTypeID , IsAc.ve , LastEditBy , LastEditDate , UserGuid, EmailStatus ) SELECT U.id, U.Username , U.LastAc.vityDate , U.Title , U.FirstName , U.LastName , U.MiddleName , U.Email , U.Phone , U.UserTypeID , U.IsAc.ve , U.LastEditBy , U.LastEditDate , U.UserID, 0 FROM #temp_UserStatus AS U
DROP TABLE #temp_UserStatus
